title: System Context & Scope Boundary
goal: Define the TMT system-of-interest boundary, external actors/systems, and scope inclusions/exclusions for the RD phase.
acceptance_checks: Identifies system-of-interest and at least 8 external entities (e.g., site infrastructure, operators, instruments, archive, power/HVAC, environment).
States explicit in-scope/out-of-scope items (e.g., AO optionality, instrument abstraction level).
Uses consistent naming for TMT and top-level external entities across all RD artifacts.

title: Stakeholders & Concerns Catalog
goal: Capture stakeholder groups and their primary concerns to drive requirements completeness and prioritization.
acceptance_checks: Lists at least 10 stakeholder groups (science users, operators, maintainers, safety, data users, site, partners).
Each stakeholder has 3+ concerns mapped to requirement themes (performance, safety, availability, maintainability, data quality).
Concerns are traceable to at least one planned RD requirement item by title keyword alignment.

title: Mission Goals & Science Drivers (Top-Level)
goal: Define mission goals and science drivers as top-level sources for functional and performance requirements.
acceptance_checks: Defines at least 6 mission/science goals (early universe, galaxy evolution, exoplanets, BH growth, etc.).
Maps each goal to at least one capability statement (collect light, high angular resolution, long exposures).
Uses a consistent goal/capability taxonomy that will be reused in RD traceability.

title: Assumptions, Dependencies, and Constraints Register
goal: Document RD assumptions, external dependencies, and programmatic/physical constraints (including site constraints) that shape requirements.
acceptance_checks: Contains at least 15 assumptions and 10 constraints with rationale.
Marks each item with status (assumed/confirmed/open) and impact area (ops, safety, performance, cost, schedule).
Includes site-related constraints and how they influence operational requirements.

title: Black-Box Functions Overview
goal: Establish the system-level black-box functions and their intent as the basis for functional requirements.
acceptance_checks: Includes at least 10 black-box functions (collect light, pointing/tracking, phasing, WFS, instrument hosting, sequencing, data capture, safety).
Each function has a short definition and primary inputs/outputs identified at a high level.
Function names align with subsequent functional requirement titles (prefix consistency).

title: Observation Lifecycle Functional Decomposition
goal: Decompose the end-to-end observation lifecycle into functional steps used to derive requirements and scenarios.
acceptance_checks: Covers startup, slew, acquisition, alignment/phasing, (optional) AO closure, exposure loop, calibration, shutdown.
Identifies at least 3 alternate paths (weather abort, fault abort, instrument unavailable).
Maps each lifecycle step to at least one functional requirement placeholder.

title: Pointing, Tracking & Stabilization Functional Requirements Set
goal: Define functional requirements for pointing, tracking, settling, guiding, and stabilization needed for long exposures.
acceptance_checks: At least 12 functional requirements with clear shall-statements.
Includes interfaces to mount/encoders and guidance sensors at requirement level (no design decisions).
Each requirement includes a measurable criterion placeholder (tolerance/latency/settling) even if TBD.

title: Optical Alignment & Segment Phasing Functional Requirements Set
goal: Define functional requirements for segmented M1 alignment, segment actuation, metrology, and phasing loop behaviors.
acceptance_checks: References segmented primary mirror concept and supports segment-level control behaviors.
At least 12 functional requirements including sensing, compute, command, verify, and maintain phasing.
Includes modes: initial alignment, continuous maintenance, recovery after disturbance.

title: Instrument Hosting & Services Functional Requirements Set
goal: Capture functional requirements for instrument ports, selection, service provisioning (power/data/thermal/control), and calibration unit interaction.
acceptance_checks: At least 10 functional requirements covering port selection, service enable/disable, health checks, safe isolation.
Includes requirement hooks for instrument metadata and configuration management.
Defines required service categories without prescribing exact protocols.

title: Observatory Control & Sequencing Functional Requirements Set
goal: Define OCS-level functional requirements for sequencing, configuration, telemetry, alarms, and operator interactions.
acceptance_checks: At least 15 functional requirements for sequencing, state management, command authorization, and automation.
Includes fault detection/notification actions and safe-state transitions as functional obligations.
Defines minimum telemetry/logging functional obligations for post-run analysis.

title: Data Acquisition, Metadata & Data Product Functional Requirements Set
goal: Define functional requirements for raw data capture, metadata integrity, quick-look QA, pipeline interfaces, and archive delivery.
acceptance_checks: At least 12 functional requirements covering capture, timestamping, metadata completeness, integrity checks, and transfer.
Includes requirements for traceable provenance (configuration + environmental + calibration context).
Defines data delivery interfaces at black-box level (no storage technology commitments).

title: Safety, Interlocks & Emergency Response Functional Requirements Set
goal: Capture functional requirements for personnel safety, interlocks, emergency stop, hazard detection, and controlled shutdown.
acceptance_checks: At least 15 functional safety requirements with explicit trigger/action outcomes.
Includes at least 5 hazards and corresponding required mitigations (e.g., motion hazards, high voltage, laser if applicable).
Defines safe-state behavior obligations across major subsystems without implementation specifics.

title: Performance NFR: Sensitivity & Angular Resolution (Optical/IR)
goal: Define top-level performance non-functional requirements for sensitivity and angular resolution drivers.
acceptance_checks: Contains measurable performance targets placeholders (units identified, TBD allowed).
Includes assumptions about observing bands/conditions as constraints or notes.
Links performance NFRs to at least 3 enabling functional requirement sets (phasing, tracking, AO optional).

title: Performance NFR: Pointing/Tracking Stability & Jitter
goal: Define stability/jitter-related NFRs supporting long exposures and image quality.
acceptance_checks: Defines at least 8 NFRs with measurable criteria placeholders (frequency band, RMS, settling).
Captures environmental contributors (wind/thermal) as assumptions or influencing factors.
Ensures terminology consistency: stability vs accuracy vs repeatability.

title: Availability, Reliability & Maintainability (ARM) NFR Set
goal: Define availability, reliability, maintainability targets aligned to scheduled observing time and operations.
acceptance_checks: Includes at least 12 NFRs covering availability, MTBF/MTTR placeholders, maintainability constraints, spares strategy assumptions.
Addresses maintainability for segment handling/replacement and instrument swap operations.
Defines availability measurement context (nightly operations window, downtime categories).

title: Environmental NFR: Thermal, Wind, Dust, and Site Conditions
goal: Capture environment-driven NFRs and operational constraints for performance and safety.
acceptance_checks: Defines at least 10 environment-related NFRs with measurable placeholders (temperature gradients, wind limits, cleanliness class).
Includes operational constraints for when observing must be paused/aborted.
Maps each environmental constraint to impacted functions (tracking, dome, phasing, instrument stability).

title: Interface NFR: Timing, Latency, Synchronization
goal: Define NFRs for system timing, synchronization, and latency critical to control loops and data integrity.
acceptance_checks: Defines at least 8 NFRs (clock sync, timestamp accuracy, command latency, telemetry rates).
Includes constraints for loop closure timing (phasing, guiding, AO if applicable) as placeholders.
States verification approach placeholders (time correlation tests, end-to-end latency measurement).

title: Safety & Compliance NFR: Standards/Policies Alignment
goal: Capture compliance-oriented NFRs (safety procedures, operational constraints, auditability) relevant to site and partners.
acceptance_checks: At least 10 compliance NFRs (training, access control, audit logs, safety certification hooks).
Includes explicit auditability and traceability requirements for safety events.
Does not hardcode specific local regulations unless stated as assumptions; uses placeholders if unknown.

title: External Interfaces Inventory (System Context I/O)
goal: List and characterize external interfaces (power, network, environment, operators, instruments, archive) to seed interface requirements.
acceptance_checks: At least 15 external interfaces with direction (in/out/bidirectional) and data/energy/material type.
Identifies criticality and safety relevance flags per interface.
Aligns interface names with later requirement statements.

title: Instrument Port Interface Requirements (Black-Box)
goal: Define black-box interface requirements for instrument ports (mechanical, electrical, data, thermal, control).
acceptance_checks: Defines at least 12 interface requirements grouped by service type (power/data/thermal/control/mechanical).
Includes service enable/disable, isolation, and safety interlock requirements.
Contains measurable placeholders (capacity, connector class, bandwidth, coolant flow) without committing to design.

title: Site Infrastructure Interface Requirements (Power/HVAC/Network/Facilities)
goal: Define interface requirements between TMT and site infrastructure for safe, continuous operations.
acceptance_checks: At least 12 interface requirements covering power quality, backup behavior placeholders, network connectivity, HVAC exchanges.
Defines monitoring/telemetry obligations for infrastructure services.
Includes failover and controlled shutdown behavior requirements.

title: Operational Modes & States Catalog
goal: Define high-level operational modes/states (startup, standby, observing, calibration, maintenance, safe/park) as a basis for requirements.
acceptance_checks: At least 10 modes/states with entry/exit criteria and allowed transitions described textually.
Identifies which subsystems must be enabled/disabled per mode (at black-box level).
Includes at least 3 degraded modes (e.g., partial instrument capability, limited tracking).

title: Representative Operational Scenarios Set (Primary + Alternates)
goal: Capture scenario narratives that drive completeness: nominal observing and key exception paths.
acceptance_checks: Includes at least 8 scenarios: startup, slew, acquisition, phasing, AO optional, exposure loop, calibration, shutdown.
Includes at least 4 exception scenarios: weather abort, fault abort, instrument swap failure, interlock trip.
Each scenario references the relevant functional requirement set IDs by keyword alignment.

title: Fault Response & Safe-State Requirements (Operational)
goal: Define operational requirements for detection, annunciation, safe-state entry, recovery, and logging across fault classes.
acceptance_checks: At least 15 requirements organized by fault class (motion, thermal, power, network, sensor failure).
Defines safe-state objectives and required operator notifications for each class.
Specifies minimum logging/telemetry capture requirements during faults.

title: Verification Strategy & Evidence Types (RD-Level)
goal: Define verification approach categories (analysis, test, inspection, demonstration) and evidence expectations for key requirement groups.
acceptance_checks: Maps at least 30 requirements (or requirement groups) to a verification method placeholder.
Defines evidence artifacts list (test reports, logs, calibration records, analysis models).
Includes verification constraints for safety and data integrity requirements.

title: Traceability Backbone: Goals → Capabilities → Requirements
goal: Create the RD traceability structure linking science goals to capabilities and to functional/NFR requirement sets.
acceptance_checks: At least 6 goals mapped to at least 10 capabilities mapped to at least 40 requirements (by group or individual).
No orphan goals or orphan capability nodes in the trace structure.
Consistent identifiers and naming across trace links.

title: Traceability Backbone: Requirements → Verification (Top-Level)
goal: Define RD-level trace from requirement sets to verification strategy elements and evidence placeholders.
acceptance_checks: At least 40 requirements (or grouped requirements) trace to at least one verification method and one evidence placeholder.
Identifies high-risk requirements needing multiple verification methods (e.g., performance + safety).
Trace links are directionally consistent and non-duplicative.

title: RD Package Structure & Naming Conventions
goal: Define the SysML v2 package tree layout for requirements (NF/F/IF/OPS/VER/TR) to enforce model consistency and parsing stability.
acceptance_checks: Defines a package tree with at least 6 top-level packages (Context, Functions, NFR, Interfaces, Ops, Verification/Trace).
Includes naming rules for requirement defs/usages and ID patterns (e.g., RD-F-###, RD-NF-###).
Can be parsed into a package tree without unresolved imports or duplicate names.

title: TMT System-of-Interest White-Box Decomposition (Level 1)
goal: Define the top-level TMT part decomposition into primary architectural modules (optics, structure/mount, enclosure/site, APS/WFS, AO, instruments, OCS/software, data, safety, O&M).
acceptance_checks: Contains one package with a single TMT SoI part def and at least 10 top-level subsystem parts.
Subsystem names align with RD-F-001 black-box functions and RD-IF-001 external interfaces (no orphan external entities).
All parts use consistent naming convention and are placed under a BDD package structure compatible with RD-PKG-001.

title: TMT System Boundary: External Entities ↔ Internal Subsystems Mapping (Structural)
goal: Introduce structural placeholders for external entities and map them to the internal subsystem parts that own the interfaces, preparing for later IBD allocations.
acceptance_checks: Defines external entity part defs (e.g., PowerGrid, Site_Network_Backbone, Time_Frequency_Reference) and references internal subsystem parts from BDD-SYS-001.
Each external interface item from RD-IF-001 is mapped to exactly one owning internal subsystem (owner is explicit via comments/attributes/relationships).
No internal subsystem part is left without at least one external dependency or an explicit 'no external interface' note.

title: PD OPT 001: Optical Wavefront Error (WFE) Allocation Budget (M1/M2/M3/APS/AO)
goal: Allocate WFE contributors across optical train elements (M1 segments, M2, M3), alignment & phasing, and optional AO residuals, establishing explicit allocations and margins for PD baselining.
acceptance_checks: Defines WFE value types with units and at least 10 contributor terms (fabrication, gravity, thermal, alignment, phasing residual, AO residual optional, etc.)

title: PD OPT 002: End-to-End Throughput Budget (Optics + Instruments)
goal: Define an end-to-end throughput budget across optical surfaces and instrument interfaces, including allocation per surface group and an overall minimum throughput target tied to sensitivity NFR.

Includes at least 8 throughput contributors (mirror reflectivity per surface group, scattering, obscuration, instrument interface losses)

References RD-NF-001 sensitivity terms and includes margin/contingency line items

goal: Allocate pointing and tracking error contributors (model error, encoder error, servo error, wind shake, structural flexure) and define roll-up to meet RD pointing/tracking functional and NFR constraints.

Includes a margin policy attribute (e.g., reserve percent) applied consistently to totals

goal: Quantify and allocate vibration/windshake contributions due to enclosure wind environment and mount/structure dynamics, providing parameters used by pointing/jitter budgets.

goal: Budget raw data rates, metadata overhead, quick-look products, pipeline outputs, and archive ingest volumes to ensure feasibility against interface and data requirements.
